alert.note: Alert for Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 9:52AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues across portions of northwest Travis and Williamson Counties. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Travis and Williamson. * WHEN...Until noon CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas continuing at least through noon today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM CST, There is light rain falling across parts of Travis and Williamson Counties as of 950 AM with rain coming to an end within the next hour or so. Very little accumulations are expected for the next few hours. However, there are multiple street closures across these areas with water slowly coming down. Therefore, the Flood Advisory is now in effect through noon today to allow the water levels to continue to come down. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations are likely experiencing flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Cedar Park, Georgetown, Pflugerville, Taylor, Granger, Serenada, Anderson Mill, Leander, Hutto, Liberty Hill, Jarrell, Florence, Weir, Georgetown Dam, Sun City, Coupland, Jonestown and Jonah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
